description: While the Arrangement has expanded to include controls on ‘intrusion software’, the structure of the Arrangement is such that control means physical exports of devices, chips, and hardware modules. As a result, many information flows related to cloud services fall in grey areas

title: Myanmar earthquake: 4.7 magnitude tremors felt across Assam, Manipur

This seismic event, centered southeast of Ukhrul, followed a 3.4 magnitude quake in Maharashtra and a 3.3 magnitude tremor in Tibet, indicating recent widespread seismic activity.

title: Scientists turn to the moon to catch spacetime’s faintest music
description: To detect gravitational waves, a detector must be isolated from all vibrations that could obscure the elusive signals. Even the world’s frontline observatories can thus only spot gravitational waves from 7 billion lightyears away. This may be about to change as cosmologists look forward to opening a new window on the gravitational sky

He revealed government cheques for the 2009 T20 World Cup winners bounced. Pakistan Cricket Board refused to handle it. This contrasts with India's immediate cash prize for their squad. The incident highlights player treatment differences.

Naqvi, also Pakistan's interior minister, subsequently removed the trophy, leading to India celebrating without it. The incident escalated into a political spat between the two nations.

Indian aid for Palestine close to record $80m in last 11 years: Govt
description: India doubled its developmental aid to Palestine in the last eleven years. This assistance totals nearly eighty million dollars. India maintains its long-standing commitment to a two-state solution. It continues humanitarian support through UNRWA despite challenges. India has not voted against any Israel-Palestine resolutions at the UN. The nation balances ties with Israel and Palestinian support.

title: Livestock transformation action plan should be guiding framework: Minister
Jiya 1st autistic female to swim across Catalina Channel in US
description: Jiya Rai, a 17-year-old Indian para swimmer with Autism Spectrum Disorder, made history by becoming the first female with ASD to successfully swim the treacherous 34-km Catalina Channel solo. She completed the feat in over 15 hours, dedicating her swim to autism awareness. This achievement adds to her accolades, including India's highest honour for young achievers.

title: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban SPLIT after 19 years of marriage: Reports
description: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban have reportedly split after 19 years of marriage, with sources indicating they've been living apart since early summer. The separation is described as "one-sided," with Kidman reportedly trying to save the relationship while Urban moved out. Speculation arose earlier when Kidman applied for Portuguese residency alone.

title: Ladakh: Govt intrigued at violence even after ‘unprecedented’ vikas; fringes in focus
description: Ladakh grapples with unrest despite significant post-2019 development, including enhanced connectivity, education, and tourism, officials claim. They find it ironic given the region's progress since gaining UT status. However, the violence stems from long-standing demands for statehood, Sixth Schedule protections, and resource control, which local bodies have consistently raised, overshadowing perceived development gains.

title: Sociology student from Mumbai wins Srinivas Rayaprol Poetry Prize 2025
description: The prize, including a citation and cash award of ₹15,000, will be presented on October 25, marking the birth centenary of Srinivas Rayaprol.

FTA push: EU envoy flags missed opportunity; calls for full engagement by year-end
description: The 13th India-EU FTA round was a "missed opportunity," though both aim for a year-end deal, with another round set for October 6. Lingering issues persist, notably India's Russia ties, including energy and military exercises, which the EU views as an impediment to deeper relations despite shared strategic diversification goals.

title: Odisha Cabinet approves 10-hour shifts; allows night shifts for women
description: The overtime work limit has been increased from 115 hours to 144 hours every financial quarter.

description: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw virtually flagged off three new Amrit Bharat Express trains and four local passenger trains, significantly boosting Bihar's rail connectivity. A ceremonial event at Patna Junction marked the occasion. Vaishnaw highlighted Bihar's fully electrified rail network and 1,899km of new track laid, with new services scheduled to commence shortly.

title: Fifty years ago | U.S. technicians aided Israel in 1973 war: Sadat
Karur tragedy: Stampede FIR names 3 of Vijay’s party; 1 arrested
description: Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam's Karur secretary Mathiazhagan was arrested Monday night, named a prime suspect in the September 27 stampede that killed 41 people. Police alleged delays, mismanagement, and chaos at actor Vijay’s rally triggered the fatal crowd crush. General secretary Bussy Anand and joint general secretary CTR Nirmal Kumar were also implicated.

title: Why comedian Heather McMahan apologized after targeting Rory McIlroy at the Ryder Cup
description: Comedian Heather McMahan faced criticism for heckling golfer Rory McIlroy at the Ryder Cup. She shouted vulgarities during his tee-off. The incident went viral. McMahan later apologized and resigned from her hosting role. McIlroy maintained composure despite the disturbance. The PGA of America increased security. This event sparked debate on fan behavior at sports events.

Warfare measured in secs now, be ready with futuristic roadmap: Rajnath Singh
description: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh directs the Coast Guard to develop a future roadmap. He stresses technology integration for maritime security. Warfare now measures in hours and seconds. Satellites, drones, and sensors redefine conflict. India must use AI and machine learning to counter threats. Preparedness, adaptability, and rapid response are essential. Geopolitical events also require close tracking for readiness.

title: US pharma tariffs to have limited impact in India: Govt to panel
description: The Union commerce ministry stated US tariffs on Indian pharma exports will have limited impact due to generic drug focus and similar tariffs on China. However, marine exports face a significant disadvantage from high US tariffs. India is actively diversifying export markets and pursuing FTAs to boost trade and reduce US dependence.

title: Buccaneers’ Bucky Irving faces injury concerns ahead of Week 5 vs Seahawks
description: Tampa Bay Buccaneers' star running back Bucky Irving faces an uncertain Week 5 status against the Seattle Seahawks after head coach Todd Bowles confirmed an MRI. Irving's potential absence, following his explosive 165-scrimmage-yard Week 4, raises concerns for the Bucs' offense already battling other injuries. His availability is crucial for their strategy against Seattle.

title: Central leadership imprint on return of six expelled leaders to Rajasthan Cong.
Concerned over takedowns, will appeal HC’s Sahyog order: X
description: X expressed deep concern over a Karnataka HC order empowering police to issue arbitrary content takedown notices via a new portal, Sahyog. The platform plans to appeal, arguing the regime lacks legal basis, violates constitutional rights, and circumvents IT Act Section 69A. The HC, however, dismissed X's petition, asserting Indian law and cautioning against unregulated speech.

title: ‘Fulfil poll promise on granting affiliation to Haryana schools’

description: The Punjab and Haryana High Court ruled pension must be treated as income for motor accident compensation, calling it a “deferred fruit of hard work.” The court significantly raised compensation for Manjit Kaur and her son from Rs 7.9 lakh to Rs 31 lakh, noting the tribunal wrongly ignored her late husband’s two pensions.

title: Over 5,200 MCD frontline staff go on indefinite strike

UP: Wolf believed to have killed four kids found dead in Bahraich; autopsy ordered
description: A wolf, believed responsible for killing four children and injuring a dozen villagers in Bahraich, was found dead under mysterious circumstances. Forest officials rejected claims of it being shot, awaiting post-mortem results to confirm its identity and cause of death. Meanwhile, compensation was distributed to victims, and searches continue for another wolf, urging caution.

Bareilly tension: 38 shops sealed over ‘encroachment’; crackdown to continue
description: Bareilly authorities sealed 38 shops, mainly minority-owned, following recent clashes between police and “I Love Muhammad” campaign protesters. Shopkeepers allege the civic action is a reprisal, claiming a court stay and lack of notice. Officials, however, assert the sealing targets rioters and addresses encroachment on government land. Internet services remain suspended as security forces maintain vigilance in the city.

title: Odisha: For family needs, HC allows early withdrawal of FD
description: Orissa High Court provided relief to a woman. She needed funds for urgent family needs. The court allowed premature encashment of her National Savings Time Deposit. Postal authorities had previously denied her request. The court cited Hindu law and amended rules. It set a two-week deadline for processing the withdrawal. Funds belong to the depositor.

description: Congress has decided to boycott the joint parliamentary committee vetting three contentious bills, which mandate automatic dismissal of jailed CMs and ministers. This decision follows similar boycotts by TMC, SP, AAP, and Sena UBT, potentially leading to a complete opposition no-show. The move highlights concerns about opposition unity regarding the bills tabled by Union Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: No immunity from Pocso FIR despite marrying survivor, having child: HC
description: Nagpur HC refused to quash a Pocso case against a man who married a 17-year-old and fathered her child, ruling a minor's consent is irrelevant. The court emphasized that taking a minor from lawful custody constitutes an offense, irrespective of marriage or the girl's current support for the accused. Courts must adhere to existing law.

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the new Delhi BJP office on September 29 during Navratri celebrations. In his address, he praised the NDA’s governance model, highlighting improvements in security, anti-corruption, and public savings. He cited increased tax exemptions and GST reforms that benefit common citizens. PM Modi also called on BJP workers to promote Swadeshi products with pride, encouraging every shop to display a bold sign reading, “Say with pride, this is Swadeshi.”

title: Uttarakhand: HC grants anticipatory bail in conversion case; sets conditions
description: Uttarakhand High Court granted anticipatory bail to Mohd Muntazir. He faced charges under BNS section 87 and the Freedom of Religion Act. A man accused Muntazir of kidnapping his wife. The woman later told investigators she willingly converted to Islam. She stated she now lives with Muntazir. The court emphasized personal liberty.

title: Government rolls out 100% subsidy for EV charging infrastructure under PM E-Drive
description: The government’s PM E-DRIVE scheme will prioritise the installation of electric vehicle charging stations in cities with a population exceeding one million as per the 2011 census, smart cities as notified by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs, and satellite towns connected to the seven major metro cities

title: Paper leak protest called off after Dhami promises CBI probe
description: Vexed with the recent paper leak in the Uttarakhand Subordinate Services Selection Commission (UKSSSC) graduate-level examination held on September 21, students across the State launched massive protests forcing the government to form an SIT under the chairmanship of a retired High Court judge to investigate the leak. The students, however, remained adamant for a CBI probe

title: Social and Educational Survey: DK administration requests people in Mangaluru to voluntarily submit survey forms

The BJP aims for over 125 seats, confident of securing 150+ with allies, as seat-sharing talks await the reservation lottery.

Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on US’ H-1B visa fees hike: A great start, but...
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang has backed President Trump's H-1B visa program overhaul, hailing it as a "great start" to address system abuse. However, Huang warned that the new $100,000 application fee is prohibitively expensive, risking the deterrence of foreign talent and driving tech investment away from the US. He emphasized that attracting global talent is crucial for America's future, cautioning the high cost could disadvantage startups and impact international talent flows, while also addressing concerns about Chinese researchers.

title: Accenture layoffs: 11,000 cut; CEO says ‘we are exiting" employees we can't retrain
description: Accenture has laid off over 11,000 employees in the past three months, citing their inability to be retrained in AI skills, as it reshapes its workforce for the AI era. The company is simultaneously expanding its AI capabilities and plans to increase headcount, reflecting a broader industry trend of adapting to AI or facing obsolescence.

title: H-1B visa policy change: Canada PM responds to Trump, says ‘maybe we can …’
description: President Trump's significant H-1B visa fee increase to $100,000 has created a stir, prompting Canada to consider attracting highly skilled professionals. Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney and industry experts view this as a "wonderful opportunity" to draw talent left stranded by the US policy, despite potential challenges within Canada's immigration system.

title: Proposed 69-km rail line between India-Bhutan designated Special Railway Project
description: Railways designated the Kokrajhar-Gelephu line a Special Railway Project. The Northeast Frontier Railway issued the notification. This 69-km line will connect India and Bhutan. The project was part of the government’s Act East policy. The final location survey was completed. This project was estimated to cost around Rs 3,500 crore. It includes six new stations, bridges, and viaducts.
